title: Introducing the Top Organic Pages Tool | Similarweb
description: Discover which of your competitors' landing pages and keywords are driving the most organic traffic with Similarweb's Top Organic Pages tool. Try it now!
content: HomeBlogUpdatesProduct UpdatesIntroducing the Top Organic Pages Tool Updates Introducing the Top Organic Pages Tool Start your free trial by Kyle Weeks , Senior Product Marketing Manager, Similarweb 2 Min. February 10, 2021 X Facebook Linkedin Copy link Free Website Traffic Checker Discover your competitors' strengths and leverage them to achieve your own success Analyze Traffic Similarweb’s Top Organic Pages tool shows you the most popular organic landing pages for any website – including your biggest competitors. Now you can dig into the performance of individual pages, examining their traffic share and traffic trends. Want more insights into a company’s keyword strategy? See which keywords are bringing in the most traffic per page and how many keywords are on that page. What it feels like This tool feels like having x-ray vision, giving you a direct view of your competitors’ content strategy. Background We built the Top Organic Pages, so you can reverse engineer any website’s organic search strategy by (1) understanding which pages are bringing in the most organic traffic and then (2) analyzing why that content is performing so well. We’ve also included these helpful filters for refining page results: Newly Discovered: Spot new pages beginning to gain organic traffic. Trending: Recognize trending pages showing steady growth. How it works The Top Organic Pages tool can be found in Digital Marketing > Competitive Analysis Suite > Search > Top Organic Pages 1. First, enter the website you’d like to analyze. 2. Next, navigate to Top Organic Pages. 3. Finally, analyze the results. (Then, add “Newly Discovered” or “Trending” filters for a more complete picture). Ready to get competitive page-level insights? Try Top Organic Pages now. by Kyle Weeks Senior Product Marketing Manager, Similarweb With experience at Apple and startups, Kyle helps SEOs grow traffic at Similarweb. He’s also a culinary school grad and Certified Sommelier. Related Topics: Product Updates This post is subject to Similarweb legal notices and disclaimers.
